question: A point object is moving at a constant speed of $1ms^{-1}$ along the principal axis of a convex lens of focal length 10cm. The speed of the image is also $1ms^{-1}$, when the object is at cm from the optic centre of the lens.
explanation: Image speed equals object speed when magnification $|m| = 1$.
For a real inverted image ($m=-1$), the object must be at $2f$.
